Mazzarelli, J.P., Friedman, Andrias, Moskowitz, Kahn, JJ.


1050 301355/10

[*1]Altagracia Grullon, Plaintiff-Respondent,
vQueens Ballpark Company, L.L.C., et al., Defendants-Appellants.


Havkins Rosenfeld Ritzert & Varriale, LLP, New York (Carla Varriale of counsel), for appellants.
Burns & Harris, New York (Blake G. Goldfarb of counsel), for respondent.



Order, Supreme Court, Bronx County (Norma Ruiz, J.), entered April 1, 2014, which denied defendants' motion for summary judgment dismissing the complaint, unanimously affirmed, without costs.
Plaintiff alleges that she was injured when, while leaving Citifield, she tripped over an unevenness in the concrete on an exit ramp. Defendant Queens Ballpark Company admits that it created the condition as part of the construction process, but asserts that it was de minimis and could not have caused plaintiff's fall.
